reg_pit.title: Extraprovincial Associations and Corporations from a Designated Province Regulation

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by 111/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

section.sectiontext: For the purposes of Part 11.1 of the Act and this regulation, Alberta is a designated province.

change.changenote: Section 2 (c) was added by BC Reg 268/2019, effective January 1, 2020.
Section 9 (a) BEFORE amended by 111/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the address of its head office outside British Columbia,

change.changenote: Section 11 BEFORE amended by 111/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

section.marginalnote: Mailing address for section 194.4 of Act
section.sectiontext: A letter mailed under section 194.4 of the Act to an extraprovincial association may be addressed to the attorney of the association or, if none, to its head office outside British Columbia.

change.changenote: Section 12 (2) and (4) BEFORE amended by 111/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, service provider means the service provider designated by the registrar to perform a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar.

Without limiting subsection (3), the registrar may collect a name search fee in the amount of $30 for a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar and transmit the fee to the service provider.
